title.narrative: Forward Thinking. Bridging the gap: creating spaces for dialogue between young Tunisians and the political establishment, engagement

policy-marker.narrative: Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Inclusive youth Roundtable Workshop – providing an opportunity for young leaders across the political spectrum to come together to meet peers from different backgrounds, discuss national challenges and identify potential response, with report circulated to politicians for broader impact. Workshops between participants and international experts – creating a space to discuss national challenges, reflect on international experiences of dealing with similar issues and identify potential policy responses and practical follow-up to meetings. Workshops between youth participants, senior politicians and representatives of the Assembly of People’s Representatives – creating an intergenerational space where young leaders can directly access senior politicians to debate policy issues and potential legislation. In turn senior politicians will have an opportunity to listen (and respond) the concerns and perspectives of the younger generation.

Inclusive youth Roundtable Workshop – providing an opportunity for young leaders across the political spectrum to come together to meet peers from different backgrounds, discuss national challenges and identify potential response, with report circulated to politicians for broader impact. Workshops between participants and international experts – creating a space to discuss national challenges, reflect on international experiences of dealing with similar issues and identify potential policy responses and practical follow-up to meetings. Workshops between youth participants, senior politicians and representatives of the Assembly of People’s Representatives – creating an intergenerational space where young leaders can directly access senior politicians to debate policy issues and potential legislation. In turn senior politicians will have an opportunity to listen (and respond) the concerns and perspectives of the younger generation.

Outcome: Expansion and consolidation of a network of informed, influential, youth activists and senior politicians with an increase of understanding and capability for addressing sources of youth frustration in Tunisia.
Outcome indicator: Outcomes measured through surveys of participants’ attitudes and actions over the course of the project and through reviewing national and international media polling data.

Outcome: Expansion and consolidation of a network of informed, influential, youth activists and senior politicians with an increase of understanding and capability for addressing sources of youth frustration in Tunisia.
Outcome indicator: Outcomes measured through surveys of participants’ attitudes and actions over the course of the project and through reviewing national and international media polling data.

comment.narrative: Many young Tunisians feel that political life is closed to them, with the political establishment unaware (or uninterested) in the challenges confronting the younger generation, let alone in helping equip young Tunisians with the skills to address the issues themselves. In polls released in 2016, 71 % of respondents felt politicians do not pay attention to the needs and ideas of young people, while 30 % blamed a lack of opportunity as the main impediment to their participation in political life.
